name: Westin Trillium House Blue Mountain

reviews.text: What a terrific place!! Not only the hotel but the whole blue mountain experience. I felt like I was far from home and we were only 2 hours away. My family and I went on a hot week and you would think that the mosquitoes would be out but we did not even get 1 bite. My children LOVED the hotel, playground, pool, plunge.....everything!!! The Westin was everything I expected, definitely a 5 star hotel. It was very clean and comfortable. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Our room had a balcony facing the pond and it was nice to relax and enjoy the stars and music in the village while my kids are asleep. The only thing was that the restaurants in the resort was very appetizing and delicious, but I found them a bit expensive.
reviews.title: Awesome....we are definitely coming back

reviews.text: Just got back from wkend stay (July 15-17)...it started off iffy at check in as lady who started to check us in got caught up w/ a guest behind us that referred to her as "Jodie Foster" and eased his way to being serviced before us and she left me staring at a wall with 4 children eager to get their stay going. Not impressed by lack of professionalism "Jodie"! She literally giggled away w/ this man who flattered her. LUCKILY...everyone and every experience after that was wonderful. We were there as a huge group celebrating a reunion/ birthday and it was exceptional. Housekeeping was great. The room great. Our request for a room w/ a village view...PERFECT! Loved it! A short walk to village for activities, short drive to everything else you could possibly need. Metro open 24hrs...just in case.
reviews.title: we'll be back...we always come back!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here July 11/12. It was just as pretty as in the pictures. Other than some minor issues with housekkeping that were resolved after the fact by the manager in a very timely manner, it was a great stay. Rooms spacious, beds comfy.....nice big TV. Beautiful view, nice pool and hot tubs. It was nice to be able to walk over to the villiages just across the way.
reviews.title: very relaxing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I know they can't build 'em tall out here, so I know why the halls are SOOOO LONG, but if you plan to be in and out many times during your stay, you might consider asking for something closer to the elevator. By the time we left, we were joking about the walk to the room being the never ending hallway!
reviews.title: Very nice, look forward to returning.

reviews.text: We defintely plan to come back during the winter - we aren't skiiers, but I think it would be beautiful to see!
reviews.title: Fantasic Hotel

reviews.text: I usually stay in the Westin trillium house in the winter months as the location to the hill, facilities with the outdoor pool, wonderful rooms and service is outstanding. Obviously this level of service continues into the summer and if u get a chance check out the eco-tour only minutes away with a 1km long zip line off the escarpment.
reviews.title: Always the best in blue!

reviews.text: I don't usually give reviews, but I was so pleased with the service and value we received staying at the Westin that I felt it was worth noting.
reviews.title: Turned our daughter's dance comp into something relaxing and enjoyable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Starting with the service. It was friendly, courteous and welcoming at every turn. It started from our check-in and ended with our check-out. In between, a room maid took time to help search for our missing iPhone, a front desk associate gave us an extended checkout and a maintenance engineer helped us boost our dead car! And even though their pool was closed, we were offered complimentary passes everyday to the Plunge next door. These folks will go above and beyond to help you out. A big thanks to all of you!
reviews.title: Absolutely Amazing Experience!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In terms of value, I think it is hard to beat. Being able to cook almost every meal in the room was a big plus. The restaurants in Blue start in the mid-range and go up rapidly. I think we saved enough everyday to pay for the room itself! Going forward, I would definitely look for hotels with kitchens. It had the essentials to cook simple dishes for our family of four. There is even a dishwasher so you don't have to waste vacation time that way.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel - Watch for Unexpected Charges!

reviews.text: We did eat out once, in the restaurant in the hotel. I would say skip it. The menu is limited and the food did not impress 3 out of 4 of us (I was quite happy with my burger!).
reviews.title: Busy hotel. Not really up to standard.

reviews.text: This was our second stay at the Westin Trillium. And again, it was just fabulous.
reviews.title: Kids were beyond excited!
Not "Resting Easy" when booking online.
reviews.text: We stayed in a 2-bedroom (1k, 1q) room that faced the village, just the right size for 2 adults and 4 kids. Everything was great, no complaints at all. Highly recommend staying at Westin, they really do a great job. In the past year we've stayed at Deerhurst and Delta Grandview, all within the same price range for 2 bedrooms. Deerhurst and Grandview have nothing on Westin in terms of accommodations.

We parked on the gravel parking lot, in the winter we stayed under-ground ($15 self-park, $20 valet) which is convenient, but since the neither the weather or ski gear was a factor, we opted for the outside/free lot. The attendants at the door are more than willing to help with luggage so you can off load and then park the car.
reviews.title: The Westin Trillium House: a little taste of Whistler much closer to home.

reviews.text: We went the Plunge Aquatic centre for 3hrs and that was fantastic, something for the kids of every age. it wasn't too busy and we only had to pay $30 for our family of 6, looking at the brochure, it would be about double the price in the summer, not sure if that's worth it.
reviews.title: Great weekend getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We also took the gondola up the mountain for a picnic and took a ride on the Ridge Runner. The Ridge Runner was a fantastic ride BUT with the resort discount, for 4 drivers and 2 passengers, it was $57! For that price it should have been an all-day ride pass! Without question, you need deep pockets for the activities at the mountain.
reviews.title: Peace, Tranquility and Class

reviews.text: I must say, the best experience i had every was being at this hotel. Everyone is very friendly and they take care of you really well. First time i went, i told them i never been to Blue Mountain (which was true) and they got me a room with a spectacular view of the mountains and village. Second time was for our anniversary and they had gifts for us in our room. Once again picked the best room in the hotel for us to stay in. The valet guys are amazing, very helpful gave great tips on what to see and when to see it. And when i came back, asked how was the trip. Finally someone who actually remembers you more than just a guest. Great family hotel room with stove top, kettle, and everything else you need in the kitchen. Small dining table was perfect for my baby during meal times. Will go back for the third time when i goto Blue Mountain!!
reviews.title: Wow!!! My best trip twice in a row!!!

reviews.text: Actually, it was a great experience with this hotel ,i had reservation for 3 nights July 3- July 6 and unfortunately, there was a fire and power was off all the day evening July 4-July 5
reviews.title: We loved it and we will be back

reviews.text: And it was very hot weather,No hot water,No condition and we had patient on Insulin and her insulin damaged(fridge was not working).Anyway, we contact the reception and they said all guest had two options either to wait till 7.00 pm and power may be backed or to take another room in Georgian Bay afor FREEEEEE and all information they had. We went to georgian bay and we Got chalet on village bu we didn't like the view then we contacted again the reception of georgian bay and asked for better view she gave us a HUGE chalet (2 bed rooms with its bathrooms) in the heart of village and had amazing view to the mountain and village as well ,its cost was 400$ they gave it for FREEEEEE as trillium home they paid for us this day..Also, The Manager reimbursed the patient whose insulin damagd and paid $50 as patient said it costs about $40 ..So that was amazing from Westrin Trillium Home..Thank you so much for your Hospitality..
reviews.title: We don't usually stay at chain hotels.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Westin Trillium is a big chain hotel with the charm of a country inn. I've lived in Vancouver and the staff here remind me of the service industry in that city. They are efficient but there is a level of friendliness not usually found in big cities and it adds another level of enjoyment for visitors. Blue mountains has always been a ski resort area but in the last several years thanks to Intrawest it's now an all season resort, with mountain biking, hiking and a raft of other energetic activities for families.
reviews.title: ABSOLUTLELY PERFECT. STUNNING VIEWS

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a light lunch and a breakfast at the hotel's restaurant Oliver & Bonancini. The lunch was excellent and my companions declared the Eggs Benedict fabulous but my bacon and eggs were mediocre and expensive which is not a good combination.
reviews.title: Perfect weekend getaway

aka: Westin Trillium House Blue Mountain Hotel
description: The Westin Trillium House, Blue Mountain, just two hours northwest of Toronto is nestled between the shores of Georgian Bay and the heights of the Niagara Escarpment.
